QuestionJSON.Question: Quinn is a big fan of soccer and they follow multiple international soccer leagues. They have compiled a database where they store team names, player names, player's goals, and assists. Quinn wants to retrieve a list of players who have over 10 goals and over 10 assists. Which of the following commands will help Quinn retrieve such player data?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: SELECT player_name FROM soccer_table WHERE goals>10 AND assists>10;
QuestionJSON.Answer2: SELECT player_name FROM soccer_table WHERE goals=10 AND assists=10;
QuestionJSON.Answer3: SELECT player_name FROM soccer_table WHERE goals<10 OR assists<10;
QuestionJSON.Answer4: SELECT player_name FROM soccer_table WHERE goals>=10 AND assists>=10;
QuestionJSON.Explanation: The SQL statement in Answer 1 is correct. When we want to retrieve data based on more than one condition, we can use the AND / OR clauses. Answer 1 will retrieve players who have scored more than 10 goals and have more than 10 assists.
